arm_group.description: Subjects in this group will be all physicians actively working at hospital centres in Spain.
Subjects in this group will be all nurses actively working at hospital centres in Spain.
Subjects in this group will be all ancillary nursing professionals actively working at hospital centres in Spain.
Subjects in this group will be all midwives actively working at hospital centres in Spain.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to determine the sero-prevalence of anti-pertussis antibodies among
      healthcare professionals at hospital centres in Spain.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sero-prevalence of Anti-pertussis Antibodies and Disease Awareness Among Spanish Healthcare Professionals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Written informed consent obtained from the subject.

          -  Subjects who the investigator believes that they can and will comply with the
             requirements of the protocol.

          -  Male and female healthcare professionals aged ≥18 years from selected hospitals.

          -  Healthcare professionals in frequent contact with patients in the hospitals.

          -  Agreeing for collection of a blood sample for the study.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        •  Medical students working as healthcare professionals.

study_pop.textblock:
Healthcare professionals actively working and involved with patient care in Spanish
        hospitals.

intervention.description: Samples will be tested to determine the presence of anti-pertussis antibodies.

clinical_study.official_title: Sero-prevalence of Pertussis Antibodies and Disease Awareness Among Healthcare Professionals in Spain

oversight_info.authority: Spain: Agencia Española del Medicamento y Productos Sanitarios

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the overall sero-prevalence of Bordetella pertussis infection among subjects with respect to anti-pertussis (anti-PT) antibody levels.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 of each subject at the time of enrollment.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the overall sero-prevalence of Bordetella pertussis infection among subjects with respect to anti-PT seropositivity status.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 of each subject at the time of enrollment.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the overall sero-prevalence of Bordetella pertussis infection among subjects with respect to anti-PT seronegativity status.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 of each subject at the time of enrollment.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: By age and gender, by type of healthcare professional, by hospital department of the healthcare professional, duration of service and time spent with patients.
secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the sero-prevalence of B. pertussis antibodies among healthcare professionals aged ≥ 18 years.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 of each subject at the time of enrollment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the sero-prevalence of anti-pertussis antibodies among healthcare professionals by vaccination history.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 of each subject at the time of enrollment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the sero-prevalence of anti-pertussis antibodies among healthcare professionals by previous history of pertussis.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 of each subject at the time of enrollment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the knowledge and beliefs about whooping cough and vaccination against pertussis among healthcare professionals.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 of each subject at the time of enrollment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Description of the household composition of healthcare professionals to identify the proportion of healthcare professionals potentially at a higher risk of contracting and transmitting pertussis.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 of each subject at the time of enrollment.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
